documents.document:
@parrots I KNEW IT
optimizations, my ass
@parrots what demon did you make a deal with to get performance gains like that
@parrots unless you’re doing things with strings
@linea_app no, totally fine 😊
trying out @iconfactory’s new sketching app, https://t.co/sfOATg06KF. i’m… cautiously impressed. https://t.co/uRWPvYKNp2
@jmacmullin @playgroundscon i wish you were, too.
@the_katie_m i’m sure someone will swede it sooner or later.
@caseyliss JELLY WILL RETURN IN [REDACTED]
@caseyliss remember topical? and mobile couch? and when the world wasn’t sadness and ashes?
as of today, the @gifwrapped codebase (with the exception of some of the frameworks i use) is _entirely_ swift. BOOM.
@YasmineEvjen it’s BEE-utiful
@parrots (until they deprecate UITableView, hah!)
@parrots you and me both, man. i honestly feel like we’re safe doing so for the foreseeable future.
@parrots that’d stop alerts, but it wouldn’t stop other uses of the URL.
@parrots my solution would be to check for alert controllers that have “review” or “rating” in the title or message, flag for investigation.
@parrots super easy to get around too, imho. literally just use a URL redirect, and you’re done.
@parrots maybe? how do you determine what alert controller is for reviews? look for ones that call app store urls in the action handlers?
@parrots i have my doubts as to whether apple can and will ever actually enforce the new alerts. just look at push notification advertising.
@parrots i just discovered this in the docs for SKStoreReviewController.requestReview(). adding this to my existing… https://t.co/frvF30wkZF

@rustyshelf @marcedwards it’s fine, russell. furbys are just evil, mutant koala toys.
nothing to worry about. probably.
@marcedwards it drops a toaster into the bath with you.

@SamTheGeek hamill spent too much time on set for them to pull that stunt again.
probably.
did a sugar skull illustration for a client today. not exactly my usual fair, but sometimes it’s good to stretch yourself, right?

@bed42 a reasonable amount 😉
dm me and we can chat about it.
@ismh i don't have a vector version of it, but i can shoot the (bitmap) sketch through to your email 😊
@ismh @mrssoup did you end up seeing the sketch i did of you?

@mrssoup heck yeah. high five to you, too!
HIGH FIVES FOR EVERYBODY
i totally feel like my eyebrow game went up a few notches with that portrait. high five to me!
@mrssoup https://t.co/mu6FusnAOt it has been an honour!
@swiftlypeter can’t come soon enough!
@parrots i miss this too. quite often.
been working on a commission this morning, which is a nice change of pace.
@RebeccaSlatkin he joined a motorcycle gang
@rustyshelf yeah. my gut reaction was not positive when i saw the news. remember sparrow? i loved that app 😭😭😭
@tonyarnold that said, loving the updates. y’all do great work.
@tonyarnold i have no idea what version chrome is at, for instance. it just quietly updates. who cares what version it’s at.
@tonyarnold yeah, which is part of why i was confused. i guess part of it is that apps which support a similar approach typically hide it.
@tonyarnold @reveal_app ah. i must have missed that section when i read the post. makes sense.
@tonyarnold i’m super curious: what’s the go with @reveal_app’s version numbering?
@nicklockwood i’ll try it when i get a chance to go back and revisit. for now i’ve dropped to NSString (and left future me a little note).
@bentrengrove that’s my guess

and the times i’m getting?
NSString: ~0.23 sec String: ~6.4 sec
for those who care: i’m pulling a series of URLs from a HTML page using a collection of known ranges.
@rustyshelf it’s about as performant as a slug covered in superglue, but don’t worry… IT’S SAFE
apparently swift’s substring methods are significantly slower than their obj-c counterparts.
sometimes, looking at my old code, i wonder if i’ve somehow landed in a universe where past me was replaced with a mildly intelligent rock.
@danielcormier at least part of the reason is because my old setup got moved to my wife’s office so she can record @Screen_Queens
@danielcormier when i’m ready 😊
@rustyshelf along with every android phone that ever existed.

@rustyshelf cool cool cool
i mean, it’s just really not that impressive unless you actually have all of them ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
@mattdonders @caseyliss i may have spent an inordinate amount of time thinking about this.
@mattdonders @caseyliss what you _really_ want is @tweetbot to implement a document picker for attaching images.
@SamTheGeek functions as intended

@caseyliss perhaps this is because @imyke is the ultimate version of casey liss
HMMMMM
@siracusa if all else fails, you could buy the game from japan? the switch isn’t region locked.
today i rewrote a UISearchBar more or less from scratch and i just want it all to be over please
@rustyshelf your hair is very blue
@rustyshelf you’re really sharing the joy around
@rustyshelf i like your peach coloured suit

@rustyshelf one two three
the number of ice cubes in the glass
@rustyshelf please look at this square button

i had a list of ~5 bugs i was going to fix today. i fixed one, and then got sidetracked on a related thing i wasn’t supposed to worry about.

@rustyshelf so that’s a yes then
cool cool cool
@rustyshelf so you’re saying the pixel is basically just a glorified battery pack? got it.

@tombrazelton oh man, i did a portrait of him a while back. his proportions are hard to nail.
@mikahsargent @mikah_ebooks you have a very interesting selection of monopoly tokens.
seems like they made it so one could simply drop a swift file into an obj-c framework at some point
@ismh great work on the lighting on this and the most recent vid 👌🏼

@AndyGraham120 oof! that’s dedication. i hope @TheRock wins all of the globes (i’m 76% sure that’s how it works).
just set up a new microphone (same as the old one) and a new audio interface (not the same as the old one)
five delivery update text messages from @auspost, from five different mobile numbers… and they still couldn’t deliver to my actual house.
@parrots “You have one day to buy a Trip Pass, or I will kill a hostage.”
@The_Dudi @_mobilecouch sadly, no. not because they don’t exist (there’s tonnes), i just don’t listen to them myself. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
@littlemissscifi a+++ would watch again
@YasmineEvjen @rustyshelf he’s only the second most competitive i’ve ever met 😉
@parrots well, let me know if you need help tracking it for real. sometimes it helps to bounce it off someone else 😊
@parrots yeah… i’m actually thinking you might need to just file a radar, and potentially track down a mapkit engineer.
@parrots ah. which means you’re not actually setting up the EAGLContext object in the first place, yeah?
@parrots could it be something to do with `multiThreaded`? docs suggest there could be correlation if the older devices don’t support it.
@parrots damn it, now i’m actually googling this.
@parrots here in 2017, that bug is already fixed.
@danielsaidi @RebeccaSlatkin the app is procreate on a 12.9” ipad pro, and the video is probably blocked because of the music ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
@_ambivert oh damn. possibly because of the music track… sorry! i’ll see if i can sort it out by removing the sound.
excuse me while i go to bed for threee weeks to recuperate.
drove to my parents’ today for a birthday party, then home again afterwards. all told, probably 6½ hours of driving.
